title: Live Briefing: Blinken in Mideast to discuss Syrian transition as Gaza ceasefire efforts continue
content: The top U.S. diplomat will meet with regional leaders to emphasize U.S. support for a Syrian-led transition to “an accountable and representative government.”
summary: The top U.S. diplomat will meet with regional leaders to emphasize U.S. support for a Syrian-led transition to “an accountable and representative government.”

title: Blinken kicks off Mideast visit amid Syrian political uncertainty
Hamas softens demands for Gaza ceasefire
Power vacuum in South Korea, a key U.S. ally, raises security concerns
content: The political paralysis could be particularly destabilizing as South Korea prepares for a Trump White House and renewed scrutiny of the alliance, analysts say.
summary: The political paralysis could be particularly destabilizing as South Korea prepares for a Trump White House and renewed scrutiny of the alliance, analysts say.

title: IDF strikes kill 15 people trying to guard aid convoys in Gaza, Civil Defense says
Australia to tackle Chinese influence with Papua New Guinean rugby team
content: A team from the Pacific nation will join Australia’s National Rugby League in a $400 million deal that deepens ties while denting China’s regional security push.
summary: A team from the Pacific nation will join Australia’s National Rugby League in a $400 million deal that deepens ties while denting China’s regional security push.

title: He thought he had escaped Beijing’s clutches only to vanish back into China
content: The secret repatriation of a Uyghur man shows China’s long reach, especially against Uyghur Muslims, whom the U.S. says are targets of an ongoing genocide.
summary: The secret repatriation of a Uyghur man shows China’s long reach, especially against Uyghur Muslims, whom the U.S. says are targets of an ongoing genocide.

title: After toppling Assad, can Syria’s rebels rebuild a shattered state?

After Assad flees to Moscow, a look at how other dictators lived in exile
content: Uganda’s Idi Amin shocked the world with atrocities, then fled with his wives to a quiet middle-class life. The Philippines’ Ferdinand Marcos lived in luxury in Hawaii.
summary: Uganda’s Idi Amin shocked the world with atrocities, then fled with his wives to a quiet middle-class life. The Philippines’ Ferdinand Marcos lived in luxury in Hawaii.

title: Data shows global conflict surged in 2024
content: Conflicts have doubled over five years, according to a report published by Armed Conflict Location & Event Data.
summary: Conflicts have doubled over five years, according to a report published by Armed Conflict Location & Event Data.

title: 11-year-old girl survives 3 days at sea by clinging to tire inner tubes
content: The girl from Sierra Leone was the sole survivor of a shipwreck off Italy’s Lampedusa island, rescuers said. Dozens of migrants likely died when their boat sank in a storm.
summary: The girl from Sierra Leone was the sole survivor of a shipwreck off Italy’s Lampedusa island, rescuers said. Dozens of migrants likely died when their boat sank in a storm.

title: South Korean president defends martial law decree, defies pressure to quit
content: The opposition is pressing ahead with a second attempt to impeach Yoon Suk Yeol, and there are signs some members of the president’s party will support his ouster.
summary: The opposition is pressing ahead with a second attempt to impeach Yoon Suk Yeol, and there are signs some members of the president’s party will support his ouster.

title: Syrian rebel forces dismantle symbols of al-Assad
content: Rebel forces led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham said they took control of Deir al-Zour in eastern Syria. Israel said its extensive strikes were to prevent a future attack.
summary: Rebel forces led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham said they took control of Deir al-Zour in eastern Syria. Israel said its extensive strikes were to prevent a future attack.

title: After toppling Assad, can Syria’s rebels rebuild a shattered state?
content: Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, the leading rebel force, must work to allay public fears that it will seek to replace Assadism with its own form of absolute rule.
summary: Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, the leading rebel force, must work to allay public fears that it will seek to replace Assadism with its own form of absolute rule.

title: Tycoon Adani pulls request for U.S. loan to finance strategic Sri Lanka port
content: The withdrawal marks another low point in U.S.-India ties after the billionaire’s indictment on charges related to fraud, and a blow to Washington’s bid to counter China’s regional clout.
summary: The withdrawal marks another low point in U.S.-India ties after the billionaire’s indictment on charges related to fraud, and a blow to Washington’s bid to counter China’s regional clout.

title: Afghan blast kills key minister, shocking Taliban
content: Khalil Haqqani was the acting minister for refugees and a key member of the notorious Haqqani network.

title: Who is Kim Guilfoyle? Trump taps ex-Fox News host, lawyer as ambassador to Greece.
content: Trump announced his intent to nominate Kim Guilfoyle — a former Fox News host, political fundraiser and fiancée of son Don Jr. —  to become U.S. ambassador to Greece.
summary: Trump announced his intent to nominate Kim Guilfoyle — a former Fox News host, political fundraiser and fiancée of son Don Jr. —  to become U.S. ambassador to Greece.

They were filming an interview on women’s safety. Then they were harassed.
content: In a viral video, a man interrupted a British journalist interviewing a mother on sexual harassment and made sexist comments, forcing the women to leave.
summary: In a viral video, a man interrupted a British journalist interviewing a mother on sexual harassment and made sexist comments, forcing the women to leave.

title: These preteen go-kart drivers are spending millions for a shot at F1 racing
content: Parents are spending millions on karting for their kids, hoping it will eventually catapult them into F1 racing. It’s a mad, mad world. And we go inside.
summary: Parents are spending millions on karting for their kids, hoping it will eventually catapult them into F1 racing. It’s a mad, mad world. And we go inside.

title: Australian leader decries hate crimes after another antisemitic attack
content: Australian politicians are warning against “importing conflicts” after the second antisemitic attack in a week. The incidents have shaken the Jewish community.
summary: Australian politicians are warning against “importing conflicts” after the second antisemitic attack in a week. The incidents have shaken the Jewish community.

title: Ukraine races to develop its own long-range weapons to counter Russia
content: Ukraine has demonstrated skill with long-range drones, hitting deep inside Russia, but experts say it needs the punch and power of ballistic missiles, as well.
summary: Ukraine has demonstrated skill with long-range drones, hitting deep inside Russia, but experts say it needs the punch and power of ballistic missiles, as well.

title: South Korean prosecutors weigh arresting president on insurrection allegations
content: Police tried to raid President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office in martial law investigation. Yoon’s former defense minister, who has been arrested, attempted suicide in detention.
summary: Police tried to raid President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office in martial law investigation. Yoon’s former defense minister, who has been arrested, attempted suicide in detention.

title: U.S. group travels to Syria in search of missing reporter Austin Tice
content: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad has revived hopes that Austin Tice, a journalist abducted while covering Syria’s civil war, will be found alive.
summary: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad has revived hopes that Austin Tice, a journalist abducted while covering Syria’s civil war, will be found alive.

title: Mazen al-Hamada, symbol of Syrian regime’s brutality, confirmed dead
content: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.
summary: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.

title: In Syria’s former ‘slaughterhouse,’ a desperate hunt for the disappeared
content: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.
summary: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.

title: Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
U.S. would recognize a Syrian government that comes from inclusive process, Blinken says

title: Analysis: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
content: The Israeli military said it had carried out 350 strikes on Syrian territory since Sunday, destroying weapons sites and effectively eliminating the Syrian navy.

title: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
content: As Iran deals with the strategic setback of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s ouster, a vicious cycle of confrontation and escalation could already be in motion.

title: About 26 killed in strike in Beit Hanoun in north Gaza, rescue workers say
Russia’s elite sound the alarm on the economy amid high interest rates
content: Squeezed by Western sanctions and soaring interest rates, Russia’s businesses fear bankruptcies as President Vladimir Putin pushes ahead with the Ukraine war.
summary: Squeezed by Western sanctions and soaring interest rates, Russia’s businesses fear bankruptcies as President Vladimir Putin pushes ahead with the Ukraine war.

title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial. Here’s what to know.
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s court appearance comes against the backdrop of war in Gaza, regime collapse in Syria and a tenuous ceasefire in Lebanon.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s court appearance comes against the backdrop of war in Gaza, regime collapse in Syria and a tenuous ceasefire in Lebanon.
